technology.short_description: The dread animator can wake the most stubborn of ancient warriors from their deathly slumber.

effects.description: Leadership: +5 for Grave Guards, Skeleton Warriors and Zombies units
Vigour loss reduction: -25% for Grave Guards, Skeleton Warriors and Zombies units

technology.short_description: A single-word boon, spoken during the ritual, will harden the skin of corpses as they jerk back to life.

effects.description: Passive ability: "Master of the Dead" for Lords

ui_effects.localised_text: Effect intensity increases with each nearby entity death.

effects.description: The Dead Rise Again: +5% chance for destroyed units to be restored after battle

technology.short_description: To enshrine an Ancient Lord of the Horde is to show the mortals just how fragile their own petty lives are.

effects.description: The Dead Rise Again: +10% chance for destroyed units to be restored after battle
Hero recruit rank: +2 for Wight Kings
Raise dead cost: -5%

technology.short_description: Mousillon might be ruled by brutal vampires, but they still maintain the tradition of tournaments for their knights.

effects.description: Charge bonus: +10% for Knight units
Speed: +10% for Knight units

technology.short_description:
A Knight is sworn to death,
	His heart knows only terror,
	His mind knows only falsehood,
	His blade has slaughtered the helpless,
	His might has damned the weak!

effects.description: Leadership: +5 for all Knight units
Ward save: 5% for Knight units

technology.short_description: A Paladin's strength comes from a higher power which guides them forward to victory.

effects.description: Weapon strength: +10% for Knight units
Bonus vs. Large: +5 for Knight units

technology.short_description: It is said that in the doom-laden land of Mousillon, the dead walk the dark and empty streets, that all manner of unnamed horrors lurk in the depths below castles, and that the night is filled with screams and laughter from beings no longer of this earth.

effects.description: Upkeep: -15% for Grave Guards, Skeleton Warriors and Zombies units

technology.short_description: Blessed be the ties that bind, for they shall last forever.

effects.description:
Raise Dead pool capacity: +2 for Skeleton Warriors and Skeleton Spearmen units
	(own provinces)
Recruitment and Raise Dead cost: -40% for Skeleton Warriors, Skeleton Spearmen and Zombies units

technology.short_description: The coming of death isn't necessarily a disadvantage, and can even prove the most special of boons.

effects.description: Speed: +25% for Zombies units
Physical resistance: 20% for Zombies units

technology.short_description: A small cantrip can locate ancient blades upon an ancient battlefield long thought lost to time.

effects.description: Enables "Dazed" contact effect (reduced Speed and Melee Defence) for Grave Guard units
Enables magical attacks for Grave Guard units

technology.short_description: Bestial chants around fell markings, eating their own, ghoulish kind.

effects.description: Passive ability: "The Hunger" for Crypt Ghouls and Crypt Horror units
Battle healing cap: +50% for Crypt Ghouls and Crypt Horrors

technology.short_description: Summoning long-lost warriors to join your shambling dead boosts the yearning hordes' capable champions.

effects.description: Armour: +10 for Grave Guards, Skeleton Warriors and Zombies units
Attribute: Charge Defence vs Large for Grave Guard units

related_attributes.bullet_text: When bracing, this unit negates the charge bonus of any large attacker.

effects.description: Attribute: Charge Reflection for Grave Guard units

related_attributes.bullet_text: When bracing, this unit deals additional damage when attacking charging enemies.

technology.short_description: Shackling Wraiths via arcane means keeps their spirits tethered longer to the mortal plane.

effects.description: Barrier hit points: +500 for Cairn Wraiths, Mourngul and Hexwraiths units
Battle healing cap: +100% for Cairn Wraiths, Mournguls and Hexwraiths

technology.short_description: Most peasants insist that every bog, swamp, and copse of trees contains a complement of man-eating horrors, and this is often not far from the truth.

effects.description: Melee defence: +5 for Grey Men and Rotten Dracoleech units
Physical resistance: 10% for Grey Men and Rotten Dracoleech units

technology.short_description: Swampaires tend to be hardy folk adept at tracking snails and frogs, which is a tricky and time-consuming business at the best of times.

effects.description: Construction time: -30% for Snail Hunting buildings
Income from Snail Hunting: +5%

technology.short_description: Frogwives are what keep the economy of many Mousillon villages a float. They take the buckets of snails and frogs caught by the village Swampaires and gut them long into the evening. Just make sure not to believe everything they say because frogwives are the originators of many strange superstitions and gossips.

effects.description: Control: +2
Income from all buildings: +5%

technology.short_description: This incantation quickens the pace of the hordes over great distances. Forever marching, never tiring.

effects.description: Campaign movement range: +10%
Battle reinforcement time: -50%

technology.short_description: Using a litany from a language not spoken for generations, the speaker can bind malevolent spirits to his cause.

effects.description: Upkeep: -10% for Cairn Wraiths, Mournguls and Hexwraiths units
Recruitment and Raise Dead cost: -10% for Cairn Wraiths, Mournguls and Hexwraiths units

technology.short_description: Behold the reapers - summoned from their cairns to enact the doom of all mortals!

effects.description: Melee attack: +5 for Cairn Wraiths, Mournguls and Hexwraiths units
Weapon strength: +15% for Cairn Wraiths, Mournguls and Hexwraiths units

technology.short_description: Those peasants skilled at bow-making are ordered to do it year round, instead of supplying a village's quota.

effects.description: Missile damage: +10% for Peasant Bowmen units
Range: +5% for Peasant Bowmen units
Ammunition: +15%

technology.short_description: The residents of Mousillon generally live there because they have nowhere else to go anymore, many deformities that are normal in the dukedom would get someone burned as a mutant anywhere else.

effects.description: Passive ability: "Disgraced by Society" for all Peasant units

technology.short_description: Round the peons up for military service, they will serve our armies one way or another.

effects.description: Recruit rank: +2 for all Peasant units
Upkeep: -10% for all Peasant units

technology.short_description: Defeated mortal Knights who fought valiantly are, on occasion, granted the Blood Kiss.

effects.description: Upkeep: -10% for Hellsteed Knights, Blood Knights and Black Grail Knights units
Recruitment and Raise Dead cost: -10% for Hellsteed Knights, Blood Knights and Black Grail Knights units

technology.short_description: From blood comes wealth, stature and power. Dark Magic may be the thing Vampires seek, but it is the blood of the living that sustains them.

effects.description: Income from Cities: +25%
Growth: +15

technology.short_description: The Vampires' baleful rituals are enacted to ensure the spread of Undeath.

effects.description:
Vampiric corruption: +2
	(all provinces)

technology.short_description: Even the lowly peasants feel inspired when they are given a greater purpose.

effects.description: Leadership: +5 for all Peasant units

technology.short_description: Folding steel takes great skill; the more folds, the stronger and sharper the blade.

effects.description: Melee attack: +5 for Men-At-Arms units
Armour-piercing weapon damage: +3 for Men-At-Arms units

technology.short_description: The designs of these mighty furnaces have been stolen from Nuln, and are used to create better equipment for the peasantry.

effects.description: Armour: +10 for all Peasant units

technology.onscreen_name: Serve in Life or in Death
technology.short_description: The living within Mousillon have become accustomed to existing with monsters and undead. On a bright side, they don't have to pay their tithes in gold anymore.

effects.description: Attribute: Immune to Psychology for all Peasant units

related_attributes.bullet_text: The unit is immune to psychological attacks (Fear & Terror).

effects.description: Casualty replenishment rate: +5%

technology.short_description: "Mousillon was once ruled by a just and even-handed ruler, yet no more. Now the land is blighted; forsaken by the light and all but the most stalwart residents. Death stalks Mousillon, and they call him "My Lord."

effects.description: Control: +2 in own provinces where an army is present

technology.short_description: The tenets of Lahmia encourage Vampires to inveigle themselves into the mortal populace.

effects.description: War co-ordination target cost: -30%
Tribute from vassals: +30%

technology.short_description: As a Vampire grows in dark majesty, others of evil intent will flock to this master, for they also crave power.

effects.description: Hero recruit rank: +2 for Damsels
Hero recruit rank: +2 for Necromancers

technology.short_description: Pulling all the strings, his puppets are willing tools, ready to be used at their master's command.

effects.description: [HIDDEN - do not translate] Used to increase lord rank when replacing a lord (target the effect at forces factionwide) - use in conjunction with a shown effect that targets provinces factionwide
Lord recruit rank: +2
Hero action cost: -33%
Hero recruitment cost: -33%
Leadership: +10 for Lords and embedded Heroes

technology.short_description: The poor must be cared for, just enough to ensure productivity.

effects.description: Recruitment cost: -10% for all Peasant units
Growth: +10

technology.short_description: For those not born into nobility, there are only few ways to gain enough power to survive the unforgiving lands of Mousillon.

effects.description: Missile damage: +10% for Brigands and Mounted Brigands units
Ward save: 5% for Brigands and Mounted Brigands units

technology.short_description: This requires educated men, resource often gathered by kidnapping the students of the universities of Estalia or the Empire.

effects.description: Missile strength: +10% for Field Trebuchet units
Reload time reduction: +15% for Field Trebuchet units
Leadership: +5 when laying siege or encircling

technology.short_description: Some Vampires are masters of disguise, using their charm and magic to infiltrate powerful organisations and noble houses.

effects.description: Allegiance points gained: +25%
Diplomatic relations: +10 with all factions

technology.short_description: Witching Night is the best time for ritual sacrifice, for evil gods are awaiting such gifts at year's turn.

effects.description: Hero recruit rank: +2 for Wight Kings
Hero recruit rank: +2 for Banshees

technology.short_description: As its dark empire rots, the Midnight Aristocracy clings to pride and the fineries of nobility ever more strongly.

effects.description: Income from trade tariffs: +5%
Tradable resources produced: +5%
Armour: +5 for Lords and embedded Heroes

technology.short_description: Bigger shovels are better shovels. Gets the job done quicker.

effects.description: Construction time: -30% for Farming buildings
Income from Farms: +5%

technology.short_description: For what is a peasant without his pitchfork?

effects.description: Construction cost: -10% for Infrastructure buildings
Income from resource-producing buildings: +5%

technology.short_description: Improve the process and the results look after themselves.

effects.description: Construction cost: -5% for all buildings
Construction time: -1 for Province Capital/Settlement buildings

technology.short_description: Returning to the sanctuary of his Black Coach, the Vampire will begin the Lahmian art of rebirth.

effects.description: Passive ability: "Black Nimbus" for all Blood Carrosse mounts

attributes.bullet_text: Speed and combat penalties caused by terrain are ignored by this unit.

effects.description: Charge bonus: +10% for Black Coach, Corpse Cart, and Mortis Engine units

technology.short_description: In spite of everything, Mousillon nobles are often gracious and accommodating hosts. A noble that has been offered hospitality is treated as well as possible, to the extent when even those who come to realise what their host is often choose to ignore their host's predatory tastes.

effects.description: Immune to non-Vampire Count territory attrition

technology.short_description: To the Paladins of Mousillon, the Bretonnian Code of Conduct means nothing to them, they follow their own rules and convictions.

effects.description: Melee attack: +5 for Lords and embedded Heroes
Weapon strength: +10% for Lords and embedded Heroes
